title: Leyfields
text:
Leyfields is a <a href="housing%20estate">housing estate</a> in <a href="Tamworth%2C%20Staffordshire">Tamworth</a>, <a href="Staffordshire">Staffordshire</a>, consisting of 3-storey <a href="Apartment">flats</a>, <a href="Apartment%23Maisonette">maisonette</a>s, <a href="bungalow">bungalow</a>s and <a href="house">house</a>s. It was built in the 1960s as a postwar housing estate. It joins the <a href="Gillway">Gillway</a> estate, Claremont Road estate and <a href="Coton%20Green">Coton Green</a>. 
The estate has <a href="Saint%20Andrew">St Andrew's</a> <a href="Methodist%20Church%20of%20Great%20Britain">Methodist church</a>, a <a href="Community%20Centre">Community Centre</a>, <a href="retail">shops</a> and Wigginton Park, the home to <a href="Tamworth%20Rugby%20Union%20Football%20Club">Tamworth Rugby Union Football Club</a>.
Leyfields is also part of the <a href="Staffordshire%20County%20Council">Staffordshire County Council</a> division of <a href="Perry%20Crofts">Perry Crofts</a> and the Tamworth Borough Council ward of Mercian.
